en: She presented him with the trophy.
zh: 她把奖杯颁给了他。

en: She pressured him to quit his job.
zh: 她逼他辞职。

en: She pressured him to quit.
zh: 她逼他退出。

en: She prodded him to work harder.
zh: 她催他再努力点。

en: She promised that she would meet him after school.
zh: 她答应放学后跟他见面。

en: She promised to marry him, but she didn't.
zh: 她答应过要嫁给他，但后来反悔了。

en: She promised to marry him.
zh: 她答应嫁给他。

en: She promised to meet him last night, but she never showed up.
zh: 她答应昨晚跟他见面，但一直没露面。

en: She promised to meet him last night.
zh: 她答应昨晚跟他见面。

en: She pulled him out of the mud.
zh: 她把他从泥里拉了出来。

en: She pushed him off the pier.
zh: 她把他从码头上推了下去。

en: She pushed him out the door.
zh: 她把他推到了门外。

en: She pushed him out the window.
zh: 她把他从窗户推了出去。

en: She raced him down the hill.
zh: 她跟他赛跑下山。

en: She recognized him immediately.
zh: 她一眼就认出他来了。

en: She rejected him.
zh: 她拒绝了他。

en: She reminded him to go to the bank.
zh: 她提醒他去银行。

en: She reminds him of his mother.
zh: 她让他想起了他妈妈。

en: She returned his kiss.
zh: 她回吻了他。

en: She revealed the secret to him.
zh: 她把那个秘密告诉了他。

en: She risked her life to save him.
zh: 她冒着生命危险救了他。

en: She said nothing that would make him angry.
zh: 她没说任何会让他生气的话。

en: She said something to him.
zh: 她对他说了些话。

en: She said that she would follow him no matter where he went.
zh: 她说不管他去哪儿，她都会跟着他。

en: She sat next to him and listened quietly.
zh: 她坐在他旁边静静地听着。

en: She sat next to him wishing she were somewhere else.
zh: 她坐在他旁边，心里却想着去别的地方。

en: She sat next him with her eyes closed.
zh: 她闭着眼坐在他旁边。

en: She sat next to him on the bus.
zh: 她在公交车上坐在他旁边。

en: She sat next to him.
zh: 她坐在他旁边。

en: She saw him at the station.
zh: 她在车站看见了他。

en: She saw him break the window.
zh: 她看见他打破了窗户。

en: She saw him driving his new car.
zh: 她看见他在开他的新车。

en: She saw him eating a sandwich.
zh: 她看见他在吃三明治。

en: She saw him smile.
zh: 她看见他笑了。

en: She scolded him because he left the door open.
zh: 她因为他没关门而说了他一顿。

en: She scolded him for being late.
zh: 她因为他迟到而说了他一顿。

en: She scolded him for not doing his homework.
zh: 她因为他没做作业而骂了他。

en: She smiled at him.
zh: 她对他笑了笑。

en: She stabbed him in the back.
zh: 她在背后捅了他一刀。

en: She stared at him in astonishment.
zh: 她惊讶地盯着他看。

en: She stood close to him.
zh: 她站得离他很近。

en: She sued him.
zh: 她起诉了他。

en: She taught him how to play the piano.
zh: 她教他弹钢琴。

en: She thinks about him when she's feeling lonely.
zh: 她寂寞的时候就会想起他。

en: She threatened him.
zh: 她威胁他。

en: She threw him out.
zh: 她把他赶了出去。

en: She tied him to the chair.
zh: 她把他绑在了椅子上。

en: She told him a joke, but he didn't think it was funny.
zh: 她给他讲了个笑话，但他觉得并不好笑。

en: She told him not to worry.
zh: 她叫他别担心。

en: She told him to study.
zh: 她叫他去学习。

en: She tried to persuade him to buy her a pearl necklace.
zh: 她试着说服他给她买条珍珠项链。

en: She used to help him with his homework.
zh: 她以前经常帮他做作业。

en: She visits him quite often, but never stays very long.
zh: 她经常去看他，但每次待的时间都不长。

en: She wakes him up every day at 6:30.
zh: 她每天六点半叫他起床。

en: She wanted him to say that he loved her.
zh: 她想让他说他爱她。

en: She wants him.
zh: 她想要他。

en: She wants to kiss him.
zh: 她想亲他。

en: She warned him not to go out at night alone.
zh: 她叮嘱他晚上别一个人出门。

en: She was kissed by him.
zh: 她被他亲了。

en: She was unable to completely give up her dream of traveling abroad.
zh: 她还是没法彻底放弃出国旅游的梦想。

en: She watched him continue to fight as hard as he could.
zh: 她看着他继续拼尽全力奋斗。

en: She watched him dance.
zh: 她看着他跳舞。

en: She waved at him.
zh: 她对他挥了挥手。

en: She went for a walk with him this morning.
zh: 今天早上她和他一起去散步了。

en: She went with him to the movies.
zh: 她和他一起去看电影了。

en: She went with him.
zh: 她跟他一起去了。

en: She woke him up.
zh: 她把他叫醒了。

en: She wouldn't even speak to him.
zh: 她甚至连话都不肯跟他说。

en: She's older than him.
zh: 她比他大。

en: She's taller than him.
zh: 她比他高。

en: She's younger than him.
zh: 她比他小。

en: It looks like tomorrow will be a very hot summer day.
zh: 看来明天会是个大热天。

en: This page is not nicely printed so print it again.
zh: 这页印得不好，重新印一遍吧。

en: Doing your homework while watching TV, that's obviously wrong.
zh: 一边看电视一边做作业，这肯定不对。

en: Teach me how to fold a paper crane. I forgot how to fold it.
zh: 教我折纸鹤吧，我忘了怎么折了。

en: The anpan from Kimura is really good.
zh: 木村家的红豆面包真好吃。

en: It's the first sunny day in a long time, so the clothes should dry in no time.
zh: 好不容易出太阳了，衣服肯定很快就能干。

en: Come on, tell me your cellphone email address.
zh: 快点，把你手机邮箱告诉我。

en: Eh, give me your cellphone's mail address.
zh: 哎，把你手机邮箱给我。

en: I want to schedule next week's product development meeting. Could you pin down a meeting room for me?
zh: 我想安排下周的产品开发会，你能帮我订个会议室吗？

en: What's this song? I've heard it before, but I can't remember the name.
zh: 这是什么歌？我以前听过，但想不起名字了。

en: You're always a great help.
zh: 你总是能帮上大忙。

en: Can you please tell me your name once more?
zh: 能请你再说一遍你的名字吗？

en: And who would you be?
zh: 请问您是哪位？

en: I think that it might rain.
zh: 我觉得可能会下雨。

en: Remember to take this medicine twice a day after breakfast and supper.
zh: 记得这药一天吃两次，早晚饭后吃。

en: Make ten copies of that document and bring it to conference room number 1.
zh: 把那份文件复印十份送到一号会议室。

en: I'm sorry. Tanaka is not there for the moment.
zh: 不好意思，田中现在不在。

en: Buy some tofu on your way home.
zh: 回家路上顺便买点豆腐。

en: By Jove! I forgot my wallet!
zh: 天哪！我忘带钱包了！

en: Oh no! I forgot my wallet.
zh: 糟了！我忘带钱包了。

en: That cake looks good too. Give me a small piece.
zh: 那个蛋糕看起来也不错，给我来一小块。

en: Is the product in the ad already out of stock?
zh: 广告里的那个产品已经卖完了吗？

en: These items are 1000 yen for three.
zh: 这些东西三个一千日元。

en: I don't want to go to school today.
zh: 我今天不想去上学。

en: When you say this, you sound just like father.
zh: 你说这话的语气真像爸爸。

en: You know, when that guy drinks he changes. He keeps talking on and on, so I don't really want to drink with him.
zh: 你知道的，那个人一喝酒就变了样，话多得没完没了，我真不想跟他一起喝。

en: As a matter of fact, I won the trip to Hawaii as a prize.
zh: 其实，我抽中了去夏威夷旅游的大奖。

en: Cut the daikon radish and carrot into quarter slices and cut the other vegetables into bite-size pieces.
zh: 把白萝卜和胡萝卜切成扇形小片，别的蔬菜切成一口大小的块。

en: My dream is to become a baseball player.
zh: 我的梦想是成为一名棒球运动员。

en: Someday, I want to have my own store and make delicious food for my customers.
zh: 以后我想开家自己的店，做些好吃的给客人。

en: You can't believe anything that guy says.
zh: 那个人的话你一句也别信。

en: You can't trust anything he says.
zh: 他说的话你一点都别信。

en: If you cheat on me again, I definitely won't forgive you.
zh: 你要是再敢劈腿，我绝对不原谅你。

en: As always, thank you. You've helped me.
zh: 还是谢谢你，你真的帮了我大忙。

en: Let's be friends forever.
zh: 我们永远做朋友吧。

en: Let's always be friends.
zh: 我们一直做朋友吧。

en: I thought that was the case.
zh: 我也以为是那样。

en: Please sit here and wait.
zh: 请坐在这儿等一下。

en: Please sit on this chair and wait.
zh: 请坐在这把椅子上等。

en: Have you finished ordering?
zh: 你们点好菜了吗？

en: It would be great if we could meet again.
zh: 要是能再见面就好了。

en: Let's stop here for today.
zh: 今天就先到这儿吧。

en: Shall we stop soon?
zh: 咱们是不是该停了？

en: Move quietly.
zh: 动作轻点儿。

en: It's very windy and my hair got messed up.
zh: 风太大了，我头发都乱了。

en: My hair is a mess because the wind is very strong.
zh: 风好大，头发都被吹乱了。

en: Isn't that skirt too short?
zh: 那条裙子是不是太短了点？

en: That skirt's too short, isn't it?
zh: 那裙子也太短了吧？

en: Wow, that looks tasty.
zh: 哇，那个看着好好吃。

en: Wow! That looks delicious.
zh: 哇！看着真好吃。

en: Sooner or later, you will succeed your parents won't you?
zh: 你迟早得接你爸妈的班吧？

en: I really wonder how much the inheritance tax will amount to.
zh: 我真想知道遗产税得交多少。

en: There's a huge spider in the room! Quick, exterminate it!
zh: 屋里有只大蜘蛛！快把它弄死！

en: I'm Tanaka and I just moved in next door. Please treat me well.
zh: 我是田中，刚搬到隔壁。请多多关照。

en: You can take up to ten books at the library.
zh: 图书馆最多能借十本书。

en: It's about time you get an oil change on that car.
zh: 你那车差不多该换机油了。

en: My legs hurt because I walked a lot today.
zh: 今天走太多路了，腿好疼。

en: Don't put bell peppers in the bento.
zh: 便当里别放青椒。

en: Babies can become dehydrated from a high fever, so I was told that it would be better to send him to the hospital.
zh: 听说宝宝发高烧容易脱水，最好还是送医院。

en: I'm anxious whether I'll do well at this new job.
zh: 我有点担心能不能干好这份新工作。

en: Hot weather will continue, so please watch out for food poisoning.
zh: 天气还会一直热下去，要注意预防食物中毒。

en: Want to drink something?
zh: 想喝点什么吗？

en: There have been a lot of clothes lately that fit tightly and I don't like it. I prefer clothes with a loose design.
zh: 最近出的衣服很多都特别紧身，我不喜欢。我更喜欢宽松一点的。

en: Your face looks pale. Are you OK? Maybe it would be better if you went to the hospital, don't you think?
zh: 你脸色看起来很苍白，没事吧？要不还是去医院看看？

en: Stow away carefully the clothes you removed.
zh: 把脱下来的衣服好好收起来。

en: What clothes do you think I should put on to go to my date tomorrow?
zh: 你觉得我明天约会穿什么衣服好？

en: With those results, you won't be able to go to university.
zh: 考成那样，你肯定上不了大学。

en: He's drawing a sketch of an apple.
zh: 他在画一个苹果的素描。

en: I can't stand cowards.
zh: 我最受不了胆小鬼了。

en: I speak Spanish to God, Italian to women, French to men, and German to my horse.
zh: 我对上帝说西班牙语，对女人说意大利语，对男人说法语，对我的马说德语。

en: For some reason, my car's playing up today.
zh: 不知道为什么，我的车今天老出毛病。

en: I don't have a problem doing the laundry, but I hate folding the clothes.
zh: 洗衣服倒没问题，但我讨厌叠衣服。

en: I've never eaten such a good meal.
zh: 我从来没吃过这么好吃的饭。

en: Aah, I'm somewhat angry!
zh: 唉，我有点生气了！

en: Aah, I'm angry for some reason!
zh: 唉，我莫名地很火大！

en: I can think of him as a very good friend, but I can't think of him as a lover.
zh: 我可以把他当成很好的朋友，但没法把他当成恋人。

en: Recently, my hair has been damaged, and the split ends are terrible.
zh: 最近发质变差了，开叉开得特别厉害。

en: Maybe it's time to change my hair and do a makeover.
zh: 也许该换个发型，来个大改造了。

en: Ouch! I stuck my finger in the door!
zh: 哎哟！我手指被门夹了！

en: Ouch! My finger got caught in the door.
zh: 哎哟！我的手指被门夹了。

en: Even though the accident was six months ago, my neck still hurts.
zh: 虽然事故都过去半年了，我脖子还在疼。

en: Don't shriek in my ear like that!
zh: 别对着我耳朵那样尖叫！

en: I will return at 6:30.
zh: 我六点半回来。

en: One drop of this poison is enough to kill 160 people.
zh: 这种毒药只要一滴就能毒死160个人。

en: I watched them skin a human being that day.
zh: 那天我看着他们把一个人的皮给剥了。

en: Did you buy a return ticket?
zh: 你买往返票了吗？

en: I can't eat that much food by myself.
zh: 那么多东西我一个人吃不完。

en: You can't just answer emails from people you don't know.
zh: 你不能随便回复陌生人的邮件。

en: TV's boring today.
zh: 今天的电视真没劲。

en: I can tell whether it's Dad or not by the sound of his footsteps.
zh: 听脚步声我就能听出是不是我爸。

en: This painting is nicely done. It looks just like Mom.
zh: 这画画得真好，跟我妈一模一样。

en: Yesterday, I talked for 3 hours with my boyfriend. We hadn't seen each other for a week.
zh: 昨天我和男朋友聊了三个小时。我们都有一个礼拜没见了。

en: We will be conducting an inspection on your stomach tomorrow morning at nine, so please do not ingest anything for twelve hours beforehand.
zh: 明天早上九点我们要给您做胃部检查，所以请提前12小时禁食。

en: You're ten years too young to be driving a Lexus.
zh: 你想开雷克萨斯还早了十年呢。

en: It was a scary movie. I think I'll have nightmares about it tonight.
zh: 那个电影太吓人了。估计我今晚得做噩梦。

en: Did you know that if you mixed red and blue paint you obtained purple?
zh: 你知道红色和蓝色调在一起会变成紫色吗？

en: Good, good, you're a sweet child so you're going to bed now.
zh: 乖，你是个好孩子，现在该去睡觉了。

en: You don't want to get lost, so take your mother's hand.
zh: 别走丢了，牵着你妈的手。

en: I want to die with Getter Jaani.
zh: 我想和 Getter Jaani 死在一起。

en: Life is merely a hospital where patients are possessed with the desire to change beds.
zh: 人生不过是一所医院，每个病人都一心想着换张床位。

en: At first, I didn't like it, but it gradually became fun.
zh: 刚开始我不喜欢，但后来慢慢觉得挺有意思的。

en: It's too late to apologize now.
zh: 现在道歉已经晚了。

en: It's too late to apologize.
zh: 现在道歉已经来不及了。

en: You're in a good mood today. Did something nice happen?
zh: 你今天心情不错啊。碰到什么好事了？

en: There's a thorn in my finger and I can't get it out.
zh: 我手指上扎了个刺，拔不出来。

en: The knee wound is now festering.
zh: 膝盖上的伤口化脓了。

en: If you burn yourself, quickly cool the burn with water.
zh: 如果烫到了，快用凉水冲一下。

en: I have this briefcase in a different color.
zh: 这个公文包我有别的颜色的。

en: It's disgusting that you're sleeping in the movie theatre even though you came to see a movie!
zh: 特地来看电影你居然还在电影院睡觉，太差劲了！

en: Even though you came to the movie theater to see the movie, you fell asleep. That's terrible.
zh: 你既然是来看电影的，居然还睡着了，真是太不像话了。

en: I don't know whether I can do it, but I'll try.
zh: 我不知道行不行，但我会试一试。

en: Did you read this morning's paper? There was something written about students from this school.
zh: 你看今早的报纸了吗？上面写了一些关于这所学校学生的事。

en: Do you have a complaint to make?
zh: 你有什么想投诉的吗？

en: Do you have a problem with this?
zh: 你对这事有什么意见吗？

en: Do you have any complaints?
zh: 你有什么不满吗？

en: No matter how experienced is the woman, a pure young man will be able to enjoy a pure love.
zh: 不管女方经验多么丰富，纯情的少年都能享受到纯洁的爱。

en: The pen is the tongue of the soul.
zh: 笔是灵魂之舌。

en: There may be love without jealousy, but there is none without fear.
zh: 爱可能没有嫉妒，但绝不会没有恐惧。

en: Nobody can disturb a true friendship.
zh: 真正的友谊谁也破坏不了。

en: He who reads often and walks often, sees much and knows much.
zh: 书读得多、路走得多的人，见识广，懂得多。

en: In the principles of love, quick disappointments are usually described as remedies.
zh: 在爱情的法则中，及时的死心通常被视为良药。

en: True and good friendship must not be suspicious of anything.
zh: 真正深厚的友谊是不该有任何猜忌的。

en: Grief on the face is better than the stain in the heart.
zh: 面带哀容胜过心存污点。

en: I can't believe that this is happening. Please tell me that it's a lie!
zh: 我简直不敢相信。快告诉我这是在骗我！

en: My tooth ached when I had ice cream, so I might have a cavity.
zh: 刚才吃冰激凌牙疼，我可能有蛀牙了。

en: Raw, simmered, or grilled, tomatoes are a delicious ingredient.
zh: 不管是生吃、炖还是烤，西红柿都是很棒的食材。

en: Ginger is a food that warms up the body, so it is recommended for people sensitive to cold.
zh: 生姜是暖身的食物，推荐怕冷的人多吃。

en: The transfer student in the other class is a super good looking guy.
zh: 隔壁班那个转学生是个超级大帅哥。

en: It looks like a fish bone got stuck in my throat.
zh: 我嗓子好像被鱼刺卡住了。

en: Those glasses suit you.
zh: 这副眼镜挺适合你的。

en: Today, you didn't wear your contacts and instead had on glasses. For a moment, I couldn't tell who you were!
zh: 你今天没戴隐形，换成框架眼镜了。我一下都没认出你来！

en: I'm not good at thinking logically.
zh: 我逻辑思维不太好。

en: You're up very early this morning. Do you have something to do?
zh: 你今天起得真早，是有什么事吗？

en: I'm glad I'm not a woman.
zh: 挺庆幸我不是女人的。

en: I'm happy because I am not a woman.
zh: 我很高兴我不是个女人。

en: They were dumbfounded by the news of his resignation.
zh: 听到他辞职的消息，他们都惊呆了。

en: I'll never ever sing in a karaoke bar.
zh: 我绝对不会去KTV唱歌。

en: God exists, but he forgot the password.
zh: 上帝是存在的，只是他忘了密码。

en: I appreciate foreign languages!
zh: 我挺欣赏外语的！

en: I like foreign languages.
zh: 我喜欢外语。

en: I like them, foreign languages.
zh: 外语，我还是挺喜欢的。

en: Stop thinking for your sake only. Think for other people's, too, and act accordingly.
zh: 别光顾着自己，也替别人想想，做事要有分寸。

en: Have you ever heard the saying: "Lying leads to thieving?"
zh: 你听过“说谎就是偷窃的开始”这句话吗？

en: Brush your teeth properly before going to bed.
zh: 睡觉前好好刷牙。

en: Don't forget to brush your teeth before going to bed.
zh: 睡前别忘了刷牙。

en: My child cannot say "Kinpira style sauteed Gobo", he always says "Pinkira style sauteed Bogo" instead.
zh: 我家孩子说不来“金平牛蒡”，老是说成“金平棒牛”。

en: My kid can't say "Kinpiragobo", he always says "Kinpirabogo" instead.
zh: 我家娃说不出“金平牛蒡”，老是说成“金平牛棒”。

en: My child cannot say "Kinpira style sauteed great burdock", he always says "Kinpira style sauteed Dockbur" instead.
zh: 我家孩子不会说“金平牛蒡”，总会说成“金平棒牛”。

en: Lately, I have been busy so I have not studied at all.
zh: 最近太忙了，根本没心思学习。

en: Today, let's clean the floor until it shines.
zh: 咱们今天把地板擦得锃亮吧。

en: Wow, that's pretty. The sea is shining.
zh: 哇，真漂亮，大海在发光呢。

en: We've come nearer to the sea. I can smell it.
zh: 离海越来越近了，我都闻到大海的味道了。

en: The view from the summit is very nice.
zh: 山顶上的风景特别好。

en: When was the last time we met?
zh: 我们上次见面是什么时候了？

en: Why does the phone have to ring all the time only when I'm busy? I can't get any work done because of it.
zh: 怎么老是在我忙的时候来电话？搞得我根本没法干活。

en: Let's do it at our own pace without hurrying.
zh: 别着急，按我们自己的节奏来就行。

en: I swam very well when I was a child.
zh: 我小时候游泳游得可好了。

en: Don't just read books. Go outside once in a while and get some exercise.
zh: 别光顾着看书，偶尔也去外面运动运动。

en: 300 sit-ups every day? That's completely impossible!
zh: 每天三百个仰卧起坐？那怎么可能嘛！

en: You scared me! Don't sneak upon me from behind!
zh: 吓我一跳！别老从背后偷袭我。

en: Just what time do you think it is? You're bothering everyone in the neighborhood blasting your music this late, you know that?
zh: 你也不看都几点了？音乐开这么大声，街坊邻居都要被你吵死了。

en: Properly listen to what I'm going to say.
zh: 好好听我说完。

en: What time did you go to sleep yesterday?
zh: 你昨天几点睡的？

en: You do nothing but complain! You're not the only one who's having a hard time.
zh: 你就知道抱怨！又不是只有你一个人不容易。

en: If you dislike my way of doing things that much, why don't you just do it yourself instead.
zh: 你要是看我不顺眼，那就你自己来啊。

en: I've got a boner.
zh: 我硬了。

en: Fill her up with regular. I'll be paying in cash.
zh: 加满普通汽油，我付现金。

en: The rooster crows at sunrise.
zh: 公鸡在日出时打鸣。

en: I want to eat pizza tonight.
zh: 今晚我想吃比萨。

en: How was the concert?
zh: 音乐会怎么样？

en: Everyone makes mistakes sometimes.
zh: 谁都有犯错的时候。

en: The Cold War began after the Second World War.
zh: 冷战是在二战后开始的。

en: I don't know what happened to him.
zh: 我不知道他出什么事了。

en: If you take a nap here, you'll catch a cold.
zh: 在这儿睡午觉会感冒的。

en: What are you worried about?
zh: 你在担心什么呢？

en: Since a large area was devastated by the Tohoku earthquake of 2011, a sustained help effort is sought.
zh: 2011年东日本大地震受灾严重，需要长期的支援。

en: Although I only made a small mistake, every person quibbled about it.
zh: 我就犯了个小错，结果谁都来挑我刺。

en: Takeshi is always bossed around by his sisters.
zh: 武志总是被他那几个姐姐呼来喝去的。

en: Can you fix a flat tire on a bike? That kind of thing's a piece of cake.
zh: 你会补自行车胎吗？那简直是小菜一碟。

zh: 一个男的悄悄走近洋子，没发出一点脚步声。

en: Please pretend we never said this.
zh: 就当我们没说过这话。

en: Please forget what we talked about earlier.
zh: 刚才聊的那些你就忘了吧。

en: I should be studying English, but I want to watch a movie.
zh: 我本该学英语的，但我现在想看电影。

en: I intended to go straight back home, but I sort of wandered inside a bookstore.
zh: 我本来想直接回家的，结果莫名其妙逛进了一家书店。

en: If you don't clean your room, you won't even have a place to stand, don't you think?
zh: 你要是再不收拾屋子，都没地方落脚了，你不觉得吗？

en: The company took advantage of applicants by offering them low wages.
zh: 公司利用求职者，给他们开的工资特别低。

en: You really ought to wash your hands of this borderline illegal work.
zh: 这种打法律擦边球的工作，你真的该收手了。

en: Wolves don't usually attack people.
zh: 狼一般不怎么攻击人。

en: I don't want to fail the test.
zh: 我不想考试不及格。

en: I love Monday!
zh: 我爱周一！

en: Don't gripe about petty stuff like this!
zh: 别再为了这种鸡毛蒜皮的小事抱怨了！

en: Seeing my younger brother trembling before his bullies sent my heart racing and made me angry at the same time.
zh: 看到我弟弟在那些欺负他的人面前瑟瑟发抖，我心跳加速，同时又感到无比愤怒。

en: It would be nice to see you again if the opportunity arises.
zh: 以后有机会的话，希望能再见到你。

en: The pen is on the table.
zh: 笔在桌子上。

en: I wish you a happy birthday.
zh: 祝你生日快乐。

en: We do not just use language to say things, but to do things.
zh: 语言不光是用来表达的，还可以用来做事。

en: There was nobody.
zh: 那儿一个人也没有。

en: Even I don't know what to do
zh: 连我也不知道该怎么办。

en: I tore to pieces the picture I took with him.
zh: 我把我跟他的合影撕得粉碎。

en: I haven't slept well recently, so my skin is falling apart.
zh: 最近没睡好，皮肤状态差极了。

en: Recently, I've been suffering from lack of sleep, so my skin is crumbling.
zh: 最近一直睡眠不足，皮肤都变差了。

en: The more I think, the less I understand.
zh: 我越想越不明白。

en: The more I think about it, the less I understand it.
zh: 这件事我越想越糊涂。

en: It's a shame that I had to quit my job just when I was getting the hang of things.
zh: 真可惜，我刚摸出门道来就不得不辞职了。

en: How many times a day should I feed my dog?
zh: 一天该喂几次狗？

en: I feed my dog just before I eat dinner.
zh: 我一般在吃晚饭前喂狗。

en: How much do you feed your dog?
zh: 你每次喂狗多少量？

en: Is it OK to feed my dog lettuce?
zh: 给狗吃生菜没问题吧？

en: The only time he feeds the dog is when his wife is away on a trip.
zh: 只有在他老婆出远门的时候，他才会喂狗。

en: She feeds her dog the same thing that she eats.
zh: 她吃什么就给她的狗喂什么。

en: I don't want to think about anything anymore.
zh: 我什么都不想再想了。

en: John works in neuromarketing.
zh: 约翰是做神经营销的。

en: I have lots of things I need to do today.
zh: 我今天有很多事要忙。

en: Going out with those clothes? They look kinda bad.
zh: 你就穿这身出去？看着有点土。

en: Are you going out in those clothes? How uncool!
zh: 你就穿这身出去？太没品了吧！

en: Iceland has many volcanoes.
zh: 冰岛有很多火山。

en: Oh, it's already this late. I have to go.
zh: 呀，都这么晚了。我得走了。

en: I don't want to talk to that bloke ever again.
zh: 我再也不想跟那家伙说话了。

en: I'm really bad at parallel parking.
zh: 我侧方停车停得特别烂。

en: The wind feels great today.
zh: 今天的风吹着真舒服。

en: This smells great! What are you cooking?
zh: 闻着真香！你做什么好吃的呢？

en: I want to study Japan's history at university.
zh: 我想在大学里学日本历史。

en: Please tell me what you think about this article.
zh: 告诉我你对这篇文章的看法。

en: I guess having zero shame is the price of genius.
zh: 我想，天才的代价大概就是不要脸吧。

en: Yesterday, I ran into my teacher at the amusement park.
zh: 昨天我在游乐场碰到老师了。

en: Today I want to eat something light.
zh: 今天我想吃点清淡的。

en: Yesterday, I asked Hiromi out on a date, but she rejected my offer out of hand.
zh: 昨天我约裕美出去，结果她一口回绝了。

en: I left behind some important documents for the company at home. Sorry, but could you please go and get them for me now?
zh: 我把公司的一份重要文件落在家里了。不好意思，能不能麻烦你现在帮我跑一趟去取一下？

en: Is there another word for synonym?
zh: “同义词”这个词还有别的说法吗？

en: I'm still undecided.
zh: 我还没想好。

en: I'm still on the fence.
zh: 我还在犹豫。

en: I still haven't decided.
zh: 我还没决定。

en: I get you.
zh: 我懂你。

en: The child drew a spherical triangle.
zh: 那个孩子画了一个球面三角形。

en: Do you know what time that supermarket closes?
zh: 你知道那家超市几点关门吗？

en: She said she would arrive in 5 more minutes, but she still hasn't come.
zh: 她说再过五分钟就到，但到现在还没来。

en: Lately I try for health reasons to go to bed early and to wake up early.
zh: 为了健康，我最近在试着早睡早起。

en: There's mold on the bread. This means that we can't eat it anymore.
zh: 面包发霉了，这意味着不能再吃了。

en: Earlier, as I was walking down the sidewalk, a car drove by and splashed water on me. Look at this! My skirt and shoes are all muddy.
zh: 刚才我走在人行道上，一辆车开过去溅了我一身水。你看！我的裙子和鞋全是泥。

en: If your stomach growls in the middle of a test, that's pretty embarrassing.
zh: 考试的时候肚子要是咕咕叫，那还挺尴尬的。

en: What doesn't kill us makes us stronger.
zh: 那些杀不死我们的，会让我们更强大。

en: What doesn't kill us only makes us stronger.
zh: 那些杀不死我们的，只会让我们更强大。

en: Whatever doesn't kill us only makes us stronger.
zh: 凡是杀不死我们的，只会让我们更强大。

en: To put it bluntly, the reason this team won't win is because you're holding them back.
zh: 直白点说，这支队赢不了就是因为你拖了后腿。

en: This is money that our mother earned by the sweat of her brow, so use it carefully.
zh: 这是咱妈辛苦挣来的血汗钱，省着点花。

en: Electric cars can be recharged at home.
zh: 电动车可以在家充电。

en: People might say I'm old-fashioned, but I think that one shouldn't have sexual relationships before marriage.
zh: 别人可能会说我保守，但我觉得不该有婚前性行为。

en: The municipal government is at their wits' end concerning the garbage problem.
zh: 市政府对垃圾问题已经束手无策了。

en: There is an urgent need for improved living conditions.

en: There is an urgent need for social change.

en: I think it's time for me to change jobs.
zh: 我觉得我该换份工作了。

en: I think it's time for me to leave for school.

en: I think it's time for me to say goodbye.
zh: 我觉得该道别了。

en: Yes, I love it.
zh: 是的，我非常喜欢。

en: What is the distance between New York and London?
zh: 纽约和伦敦之间的距离是多少？

en: Quiet down.
zh: 安静点。

en: Hurry back.
zh: 快点回来。

en: Zero is what comes before one.
zh: 零在一的前面。

en: Improper grounding can make a microphone lethal to touch. Several singers have actually died this way.
zh: 接地不当会让触碰麦克风变得致命，其实已经有好几个歌手因此丧命了。

en: Grounding and other bog-standard punishments didn't get through to his son at all.
zh: 禁足或者是别的那些老一套的惩罚对他儿子根本没用。

en: She is prepared for the interview tomorrow.
zh: 她为明天的面试做好了准备。

en: Friendship lasts longer than memories.
zh: 友谊比记忆更长久。

en: She penned a tell-all memoir of her affair with the president.
zh: 她写了一本揭露她和总统私情的爆料回忆录。

en: I don't want to drink anything cold.
zh: 我不想喝凉的。

en: For example, China's public transport is without a doubt better than the UK's, but the UK's public welfare may be better than China's.
zh: 比如，中国的公共交通肯定比英国好，但英国的社会福利可能比中国好。

en: The chairman is going to resign.
zh: 董事长要辞职了。

en: I'm not able to translate this sentence.
zh: 我翻译不了这句话。

en: That guy really just does as he likes, doesn't he.
zh: 那家伙真是想干嘛就干嘛，是不？

en: But it would be great if she could go about her work a little more briskly.
zh: 要是她干活能再麻利点就好了。

en: I’ve got a big pile of homework I need to complete today but haven’t even started any of it yet.
zh: 我今天有一大堆作业要写，但现在还没动笔呢。

en: I’ve got heaps of homework due today but haven’t even touched anything yet.
zh: 我今天有一堆作业要交，但还一点都没碰。

en: What's your favorite cheese to eat when drinking wine?
zh: 你喝葡萄酒的时候最喜欢配什么奶酪？

en: What's your favorite city?
zh: 你最喜欢哪个城市？

en: What's your favorite color?
zh: 你最喜欢什么颜色？

en: What's your favorite flower?
zh: 你最喜欢什么花？

en: What's your favorite French wine?
zh: 你最喜欢哪种法国酒？

en: What's your favorite item of clothing?
zh: 你最喜欢哪件衣服？

en: What's your favorite kind of book?
zh: 你最喜欢哪类书？

en: What's your favorite music group?
zh: 你最喜欢哪个乐队？

en: What's your favorite number?
zh: 你最喜欢哪个数字？

en: What's your favorite place to vacation in Japan?
zh: 去日本度假你最喜欢去哪儿？

en: What's your favorite proverb?
zh: 你最喜欢哪句谚语？

en: What's your favorite song to sing with young children?
zh: 你最喜欢跟小孩儿唱哪首歌？

en: What's your favorite song?
zh: 你最喜欢哪首歌？

en: What's your favorite summer food?
zh: 夏天你最爱吃什么？

en: What's your favorite thing to do?
zh: 你平时最喜欢做什么？

en: What's your favorite vegetable?
zh: 你最爱吃什么蔬菜？

en: What's your favorite way to spend time in Boston?
zh: 在波士顿你最喜欢怎么打发时间？

en: What's your favorite web browser?
zh: 你最喜欢用哪个浏览器？

en: What's your favorite song in last year's top 100?
zh: 去年前一百名的歌里，你最喜欢哪一首？

en: What's your favorite thing about the Christmas season?
zh: 圣诞节你最喜欢的是哪一点？

en: Taxes are the price we pay for a civilized society.
zh: 税收是我们为文明社会付出的代价。

en: In Esperanto, nouns end with "o". Plurals are formed with the addition of "j".
zh: 在世界语中，名词以“o”结尾，复数则是加上“j”。

en: As I thought, Catherine is a beautiful girl after all.
zh: 果然不出所料，凯瑟琳到底还是个美女。

en: But we know nothing really; for truth lies deep down.
zh: 其实我们什么都不知道，因为真相深不可测。

en: What did you grumble a while ago?
zh: 你刚才在那儿嘀咕什么呢？

en: The expected high temperature for today is 32 degrees. It's going to be hot, isn't it?
zh: 今天预计最高气温32度，会挺热的吧？

en: Could you please clear the weeds from the garden and water the flowers in the flowerbed for me?
zh: 能帮我把院子里的杂草拔了，再给花坛里的花浇浇水吗？

en: I always drink milk with my breakfast.
zh: 我吃早饭总是喝牛奶。

en: I don't understand this confusing grammar question.
zh: 这个语法问题太绕了，我没搞明白。

en: Your appetite's voracious from first thing in the morning, isn't it!
zh: 你这一大早胃口就这么好啊！

en: Misudo's baked donuts are on sale today. Let's go buy some!
zh: Mister Donut的烤甜甜圈今天打折，咱们去买点吧！

en: My five year old daughter always goes to kindergarten happy and full of energy.
zh: 我那五岁的女儿每天都精神饱满、开开心心地去幼儿园。

en: I am more and more convinced that our happiness or our unhappiness depends far more on the way we meet the events of life than on the nature of those events themselves.
zh: 我越来越相信，我们的幸福与否更多取决于我们面对生活的方式，而不是生活本身是什么样。

en: It's a trap!
zh: 这是个陷阱！

en: Who's your favorite character in this book?
zh: 这本书里你最喜欢哪个角色？

en: Who's your favorite heavy metal guitarist?
zh: 你最喜欢的重金属吉他手是谁？

en: Who's your favorite photographer?
zh: 你最喜欢的摄影师是谁？

en: Who's your favorite pianist?
zh: 你最喜欢的钢琴家是谁？

en: Who's your favorite super hero?
zh: 你最喜欢的超级英雄是谁？

en: I really hate dairy products.
zh: 我真的很讨厌奶制品。

en: Even without makeup, she's very cute.
zh: 她就算不化妆也很可爱。

en: Even when she's not wearing makeup, she's very beautiful.
zh: 她就算素颜也特别漂亮。

en: I want to bring down my waist size 3 centimetres.
zh: 我想把腰围减掉3厘米。

en: Oh, I just gained two kilos. I should stop eating snacks.
zh: 哎呀，我重了两公斤，得戒掉零食了。

en: If I see a child smile, it catches on, and then I'm smiling too.
zh: 我一看到小孩子笑，就会被感染，自己也跟着笑。

en: When things are hard or when you're sad, look up at the sky.
zh: 遇到困难或者难过的时候，就抬头看看天空吧。

en: I wonder why it is that the sound of waves is so pleasant to the ear.
zh: 我在想，为什么海浪的声音听起来这么舒服呢。

en: Did you clean your room properly? There's still dust over here.
zh: 你房间好好打扫了吗？这儿还有灰呢。

en: I've made loads of sentences so that we can all get to the point of craning our necks in and being amused.
zh: 我造了这么多句子，就是想让大家都能凑过来乐呵乐呵。

en: It's thanks to the support of my family that I was able to leave that company and open up this new restaurant.
zh: 多亏了家人的支持，我才能辞掉那家公司的工作，开了这家新餐厅。

en: It's so hot outside that I want to spend all day in my air conditioned house.
zh: 外面太热了，我只想整天待在空调房里。

en: She has spent hours at the gym trying to lose weight.
zh: 为了减肥，她在健身房泡了好几个小时。

en: Before I get out of bed, I spend a little time thinking about what I'll be doing the rest of the day.
zh: 起床之前，我会稍微想一下今天都要干些什么。

en: Do you spend more time with your friends or with your family?
zh: 你平时是跟朋友在一起的时间多，还是陪家人多？

en: How do you think I can convince her to spend more time with me?
zh: 你觉得我怎么才能说服她多花点时间陪陪我？

en: I spent a great deal of time dealing with that problem last week.
zh: 上周我花了大量时间来处理那个问题。

en: I wish that we could spend more time together.
zh: 我真希望咱们能有更多时间待在一起。

en: I'd like to spend less time at work and more time at home.
zh: 我想少花点时间工作，多花点时间陪陪家里。

en: If you only had one more week to live, what would you spend your time doing?
zh: 要是你只剩最后一个星期的命了，你会怎么过？

en: If you plan well, you can spend less time doing unnecessary things and get the work done faster.
zh: 如果你计划得好，就能少花点时间做没用的事，活儿也能干得快点。

en: Last year, I spent so much time by myself that I almost forgot how to communicate effectively with others.
zh: 去年我总是一个人待着，都快忘了该怎么跟人好好沟通了。

en: Many people think that children spend too much time watching TV.
zh: 很多人觉得小孩花在看电视上的时间太多了。

en: My teacher told me that I should have spent more time preparing my speech.
zh: 老师跟我说，我本来应该多花点时间准备演讲的。

en: Parents should spend quality time with their children.
zh: 家长应该多花点高质量的时间陪陪孩子。

en: She spends all her time thinking about boys.
zh: 她满脑子想的都是男生。

en: She spends more time thinking about work than doing it.
zh: 她花在琢磨工作上的时间比实际干活的时间还多。

en: She spends time with her grandmother every Sunday.
zh: 她每个星期天都会去陪奶奶。

en: Since I have no children, I have more time to spend doing volunteer work than parents do.
zh: 因为我没孩子，所以比那些当家长的有更多时间去做志愿者。

en: The more time you spend talking about what you do, the less time you have to do it.
zh: 你花在说上的时间越多，干活的时间就越少。

en: What do you spend most of your time doing?
zh: 你平时大部分时间都在干嘛？

en: What you spend time doing in your childhood affects the rest of your life.
zh: 你小时候把时间花在什么上，会影响你的一辈子。

en: You should spend a little time each day reviewing vocabulary.
zh: 你应该每天花点时间复习单词。

en: Do you keep a dream diary?
zh: 你会记梦境日记吗？

en: In the first month of that year, I saw that it snowed for four days from the 14th until the 17th.
zh: 那年的一月份，我记得从14号到17号连着下了四天雪。

en: In January of that year, we saw snow for four days, from the fourteenth to the seventeenth.
zh: 那年一月，从14号到17号，我们见了四天雪。

en: A karuta gathering was being held at the hatamoto's estate.
zh: 旗本的宅邸里正在举行歌留多聚会。

en: They met at the estate of the shogun's retainer to play a game of cards.
zh: 他们在将军家臣的宅子里聚在一起打牌。

en: She was looking miserable sitting in the middle of this snowstorm, so I threw a small coin at her.
zh: 她在大雪中坐着，看着挺可怜的，我就扔给了她一个小硬币。

en: I wonder if she might not have become unable to move because of an illness.
zh: 我在想，她会不会是因为生病了才动弹不得的。

en: Anyhow, it's the truth that on this snowy night a lone old woman was sitting on the side of the road.
zh: 反正，在那场雪夜里，确实有个老太太独自坐在路边。

en: Just as if the card gathering had turned into a ghost story telling party, a kind of dark mood had settled over those present and everyone was silent.
zh: 就像打牌聚会变成了讲鬼故事大会一样，气氛变得阴森森的，大家都不说话了。

en: Come on, hang in there!
zh: 加油，再坚持一下！

en: I heard that there were female snow spirits in Echigo, but I don't know whether it's true or not.
zh: 我听说越后有雪女，但不知道是不是真的。

en: As the three men entered the alley, a bird resembling a crow flew from the top a large beech tree as if he had been frightened.
zh: 当那三个男人走进小巷时，一只长得像乌鸦的鸟从大榉树顶上飞走了，像是受了惊。

en: Tonight was also a windless night.
zh: 今晚也是个没风的夜晚。

en: Please fix that.
zh: 麻烦把那个修一下。

en: It's raining today. Where is my umbrella?
zh: 今天下雨了。我的伞在哪儿？

en: The brightest flame burns quickest.
zh: 最亮的火焰烧得最快。

en: There's always someone talking.
zh: 总有人在说话。

en: After this, nobody ever saw the ghost of the old woman again in that alley.
zh: 从那以后，再也没人在那条巷子里见过那个老太太的鬼魂了。

en: On the 3rd of March, at around noon, an express letter was thrown into the entrance of my house.
zh: 3月3号中午那会儿，一封特快信件投进了我家门口。

en: Friends today, enemies tomorrow.
zh: 今天的朋友，明天的敌人。

en: My mother says Japanese kids aren't naughty, but they live very far away, so Santa Claus doesn't bring them gifts. Thank goodness I was born in Spain.
zh: 我妈说日本小孩不淘气，但他们住得太远了，所以圣诞老人不给他们送礼物。幸好我生在西班牙。

en: My daughter likes to play with dolls.
zh: 我女儿喜欢玩娃娃。

en: There's a huge hole in the wall.
zh: 墙上有个大洞。

en: She can't stop me.
zh: 她拦不住我。

en: The plaza is packed with people.
zh: 广场上挤满了人。

en: I'm going to brush my teeth.
zh: 我要去刷牙了。

en: Don't touch my spaghetti bridge! The glue is still hardening.
zh: 别碰我的意面桥！胶水还没干透呢。

en: Elves are Santa's little helpers.
zh: 精灵是圣诞老人的小助手。

en: My parents read books and magazines, but I read more.
zh: 我爸妈看书看杂志，但我看得更多。

en: Your father is pretty tall.
zh: 你爸爸长得挺高的。

en: She is anxious about her safety.
zh: 她很担心自己的安全。

en: Umezawa has had the hobby of writing haikus since he was young.
zh: 梅泽从小就有写俳句的爱好。

en: Society is an insane asylum run by the inmates.
zh: 社会就是一个由疯子管理的疯人院。

en: She spends her free time making dolls.
zh: 她空闲时间都在做娃娃。

en: Best men are like the best coffee: strong, hot and keeps you awake all night long.
zh: 最棒的男人就像最好的咖啡：够劲、够热，还能让你兴奋得整晚睡不着。

en: She finally managed to get a hold of her old friend.
zh: 她终于联系上她的老朋友了。

en: Challenger exploded on January 28th 1986.
zh: 1986年1月28号，挑战者号爆炸了。

en: Today is the birthday of the queen of pop Kylie Minogue!
zh: 今天是流行天后凯莉·米洛的生日！

en: Is there an ATM around here?
zh: 这附近有ATM机吗？

en: Is there an ATM close by?
zh: 这儿附近有取款机吗？

en: Is there an ATM nearby?
zh: 附近有自动取款机吗？

en: I appreciate how hard you've worked to grow this business.
zh: 我很感激你为了发展这门生意付出的努力。

en: It is difficult to love somebody when it's not clear whether or not the other person loves you the same way.
zh: 如果不确定对方是否也同样爱你，去爱一个人真的很难。

en: She cannot stop me.
zh: 她拦不住我。

en: Today's friends are tomorrow's enemies.
zh: 今天的朋友就是明天的敌人。

en: Please correct that.
zh: 请纠正一下。

en: Five tremors in excess of magnitude 5.0 on the Richter scale have shaken Japan just this week, but scientists are warning that the largest expected aftershock has yet to hit.
zh: 光这周日本就发生了五次5级以上的地震，但科学家警告说，最大的余震还没来。

en: I work with her boyfriend.
zh: 我和她男朋友一起工作。

en: "Is this Arabic?" "No, it's Uyghur - a language that's spoken in northwestern China."
zh: “这是阿拉伯语吗？” “不，是维吾尔语，中国西北地区的一种语言。”

en: All men are mortal. Socrates was mortal. Therefore, all men are Socrates.
zh: 人都会死。苏格拉底会死。所以，人都是苏格拉底。

en: How do you write your last name?
zh: 你的姓怎么写？

en: How is your last name written?
zh: 你的姓是怎么写的？

en: Hunting is not allowed in national parks.
zh: 国家公园里不准打猎。

en: Hunting is prohibited in national parks.
zh: 国家公园内禁止狩猎。

en: Hunting isn't allowed in national parks.
zh: 国家公园里不让打猎。

en: I never saw such a woman.
zh: 我从来没见过那样的女人。

en: Do you prefer reading to cards?
zh: 比起打牌，你更喜欢看书吗？

en: You never see a fault in anybody.
zh: 你从来看不到别人的缺点。

en: She has known him only a fortnight.
zh: 她才认识他两个星期。

en: We passed each other several times.
zh: 我们擦肩而过了好几次。

en: Man is the measure of all things: of things which are, that they are, and of things which are not, that they are not.
zh: 人是万物的尺度：存在者如何存在，不存在者如何不存在。

en: His face was red.
zh: 他的脸红了。

en: That was a delicious meal.
zh: 那顿饭真好吃。

en: Thanks for the meal.
zh: 谢谢款待。

en: Thanks for paying for the meal.
zh: 谢谢你请客。

en: So friendship is also a requirement for happiness.
zh: 所以友谊也是幸福的必要条件。

en: Who is your lawyer?
zh: 你的律师是谁？

en: He dropped the sausage on the ground.
zh: 他把香肠掉地上了。

en: Mark's book is very interesting.
zh: 马克的书很有意思。

en: I love coffee.
zh: 我爱喝咖啡。

en: She loves coffee.
zh: 她爱喝咖啡。

en: Tom did not know their names.
zh: 汤姆不知道他们的名字。

en: You stole my bike, and now I'm going to break your face.
zh: 你偷了我的自行车，看我不揍扁你的脸。

en: Quit lazing about here forever and hurry up and do your job.
zh: 别老在那儿混日子了，赶紧干活去。

en: Stop moping about here doing nothing and get back to work quick smart.
zh: 别在那儿无所事事了，快点回去工作。

en: My teacher found out that I was skipping class and he raked me over the coals.
zh: 老师发现我逃课，把我臭骂了一顿。

en: I've got a little surprise in store for the downtown boys who made fun of me.
zh: 我给那群取笑我的城里小子们准备了个“小惊喜”。

en: In this world, there are people who take advantage of legal loopholes to do things that are almost illegal.
zh: 这世界上总有人钻法律漏洞，做些打擦边球的事。

en: I went to the movie thinking that it would be fun, but it left me with a bad taste in my mouth.
zh: 我本以为那电影会很有意思，结果看完感觉很扫兴。

en: He has worked in this factory for 11 years.
zh: 他在这个工厂干了11年了。

en: If the weather is fine, we will go for a trip to the countryside tomorrow.
zh: 如果明天天气好，我们就去郊游。

en: Luke, I am your cousin.
zh: 卢克，我是你表哥。

en: The small thug beat up the convenience store employee.
zh: 那个小混混把便利店店员揍了一顿。

en: She was overcome with happiness.
zh: 她简直乐坏了。

en: Do you really think that it's bad?
zh: 你真的觉得那很糟糕吗？

en: Do you really think it's bad?
zh: 你真觉得不好吗？

en: Do you really think it's no good?
zh: 你真觉得不行吗？

en: Why am I so bad at allocating my time?
zh: 我怎么这么不会分配时间啊？

en: My special talent is that I become friends with anybody, anywhere, anytime.
zh: 我的特长就是不管在什么时候、什么地方，都能和任何人交上朋友。

en: My special talent is that I can form a friendship at any time, anywhere, and with anyone.
zh: 我的特长是随时随地都能和任何人交上朋友。

en: You can't view Flash content on an iPad. However, you can easily email yourself the URLs of these web pages and view that content on your regular computer when you get home.
zh: iPad上看不成Flash。不过，你可以把网址发给自己的邮箱，回家后再用普通电脑看。

en: Oh, that kid went to sleep without eating supper.
zh: 哎呀，那孩子没吃晚饭就睡了。

en: I've had a lot on my mind recently and have had trouble falling asleep at night.
zh: 我最近心事挺重的，晚上老是睡不着。

en: Apparently, Tom had a lot on his mind, so I just left him alone.
zh: 看来汤姆心事重重的，所以我也就没去打扰他。

en: I have a small fever.
zh: 我有点发烧。

en: My child can't say "kikugobo." It always comes out as "kikubogo."
zh: 我家孩子说不来“kikugobo”，老是说成“kikubogo”。

en: The capital of Poland is Warsaw.
zh: 波兰的首都是华沙。

en: Poland is a big country.
zh: 波兰是个大国。

en: I stuck around for a while to see if anyone else would come.
zh: 我在那儿多待了一会儿，看还有没有人来。

en: If you had stuck around, you would have had a lot of fun.
zh: 你要是当时多留一会儿，肯定能玩得挺开心的。

en: Just stick around a few days and you'll come to love this place.
zh: 在这儿多待几天，你就会爱上这儿的。

en: I can't explain that either.
zh: 这个我也解释不清楚。

en: It looks like I drank too much yesterday. My head is pounding. I'm completely hungover.
zh: 看来昨天喝太多了，现在头疼得厉害，完全是宿醉状态。

en: That man over there has been glancing at us furtively for a while, do you know him?
zh: 那边那个人已经偷偷瞄我们半天了，你认识他吗？

en: Didn't you ever put on rubber boots as a kid and have fun splashing water in puddles?
zh: 你小时候没穿过雨靴在水坑里踩水玩吗？

en: I didn't sleep much yesterday, so it was inevitable that I was sleepy all day today.
zh: 我昨天没怎么睡，所以今天困了一整天也是难免的。

en: Yamada isn't very popular with the girls in his school year, but he's popular amongst the younger students.
zh: 山田在同级女生里不怎么受欢迎，但在学弟学妹里人气挺高的。

en: Yamada isn't popular with girls in his own grade, but he's popular with the younger girls at school.
zh: 山田在同级的女生里不怎么吃香，但在低年级的女生里挺受欢迎的。

en: Don't you think that the cookies that you baked today are the most delicious amongst the cookies that you have baked so far?
zh: 你不觉得今天烤的饼干是你目前为止做得最好吃的吗？

en: I don't study regularly, so there's no way that I'll get a good grade on tomorrow's test.
zh: 我平时不怎么学习，明天的考试肯定考不好。

en: I don't drink coffee at all.
zh: 我一点儿咖啡都不喝。

en: I have been abroad.
zh: 我出过国。

en: These rules are not very clear.
zh: 这些规定不太明确。

en: You don't need to make a decision now.
zh: 你现在不用急着做决定。

en: I've got some great ideas but I need money.
zh: 我有些很棒的主意，但就是缺钱。

en: How much is this?
zh: 这个多少钱？

en: Emoto Masaru believes that within ice crystals you can read a message to mankind.
zh: 江本胜认为，可以从冰晶中读出传给人类的信息。

en: I'm flattered.
zh: 过奖了。

en: I've developed a bit of a gut lately, so I've decided that, starting tomorrow, I'm going to go to the gym.
zh: 我最近长肚子了，所以决定从明天开始去健身房。

en: Now please summarize the main points in your notebook.
zh: 请把要点总结在笔记本上。

en: Let's take a break from work by drinking coffee.
zh: 咱们喝杯咖啡，歇会儿吧。

en: Why don't you quit being so stubborn and instead try to make up with him?
zh: 你就别犟了，去跟他和好吧。

en: A ten thousand dollar fine? That's nothing.
zh: 一万美金罚款？那不算什么。

en: A one million yen fine? That's nothing to me.
zh: 一百万日元罚款？对我来说小意思。

en: Don't tell anybody else, but director Tanaka wears a wig.
zh: 别告诉别人，田中部长戴的是假发。

en: Even though Marcel works hard, he only earns 30 000 Canadian dollars per year.
zh: 虽然马塞尔工作很努力，但一年才挣三万加元。

en: All I know is that something happened that scared the kids to death.
zh: 我只知道出了点儿事，把孩子们吓得半死。

en: Do you think the campaign was successful in Italy?
zh: 你觉得这次活动在意大利搞得成功吗？

en: The cook is barbecuing the chicken meat.
zh: 厨师正在烤鸡肉。

en: "How long will it take?" "About two weeks."
zh: “要多久？”“大概两周吧。”

en: Could you close the window, please?
zh: 能请你关下窗户吗？

en: Please say the alphabet in reverse.
zh: 请把字母表倒着念一遍。

en: Please say the alphabet backwards.
zh: 请把字母表倒过来念。

en: Please recite the alphabet backwards.
zh: 请倒背字母表。

en: Please don't say that.
zh: 请别这么说。

en: Please don't die.
zh: 请千万别死。

en: I decided to go abroad to study.
zh: 我决定出国留学了。

en: You think that TV is bad for kids?
zh: 你觉得看电视对小孩不好吗？

en: I love sports.
zh: 我挺喜欢运动的。

en: Tom speaks slower than Bill.
zh: Tom 说话比 Bill 慢。

en: I invited him over to my place.
zh: 我请他来我家了。

en: It's an inside joke.
zh: 这是我们内部的梗。

en: My girlfriend missed the last train to the world's end, and that's quite a problem.
zh: 我女朋友错过了去世界尽头的末班车，这可真是个麻烦。

en: I'm happy to have been able to meet you.
zh: 很高兴能认识你。

en: Let's have the one who loses at rock-paper-scissors do the dishwashing today!
zh: 咱们今天玩石头剪刀布吧，谁输了谁洗碗！

en: My rock-paper-scissors is weak. I've never heard of a sure fire way to win.
zh: 我玩石头剪刀布很烂，从来没听说过有什么稳赢的办法。

en: He seems well acquainted with the history of Japan.
zh: 他好像对日本历史挺了解的。

en: Tom's looking for work.
zh: Tom 正在找工作。

en: Why doesn't he tell the truth?
zh: 他为什么不说实话？

en: I'll show you the city.
zh: 我带你在城里转转吧。

en: Many large Japanese companies depend on exports.
zh: 很多日本大公司都靠出口。

en: Germany was once an ally of Italy.
zh: 德国曾经是意大利的盟友。

en: I often think about my deceased mother.
zh: 我经常想起我去世的母亲。

en: There aren't many students who can read Latin.
zh: 能读懂拉丁文的学生不多。

en: A molecule of water is made up of one oxygen and two hydrogen atoms.
zh: 一个水分子是由一个氧原子和两个氢原子组成的。

en: Tokyo is bigger than Rome.
zh: 东京比罗马大。

en: For him, hunger was an abstract concept. He had always had enough food.
zh: 对他来说，饥饿只是个抽象概念，他一直都能吃饱。

en: Austria's hilly landscapes reminded Mr. Bogart of The Sound of Music.
zh: 奥地利的山丘景色让波嘉特先生想起了《音乐之声》。

en: You're comparing chalk and cheese!
zh: 你这完全是在拿两码事在比！

en: Many people think that sponge cake is difficult to bake, but if you use enough eggs, nothing can really go wrong.
zh: 很多人觉得海绵蛋糕很难烤，但只要鸡蛋放够了，基本不会失败的。

en: Does this dress look good on me?
zh: 我穿这件裙子好看吗？

en: He's in the other truck.
zh: 他在另一辆卡车里。

en: I have never had any enemies other than those of the state.
zh: 除了国家的敌人，我没有任何私敌。

en: It's so easy to write good example sentences, that even if we accidentally delete a few good sentences in the process of getting rid of a whole lot of bad ones, I think we could drastically improve the quality of this corpus by doing a lot of deleting.
zh: 写出好的例句其实很容易，所以即使在删掉大量烂句子的过程中不小心误删了一些好的，我觉得通过大量删减也能显著提高这个语料库的质量。

en: I keep the master copy under lock and key.
zh: 我把原件锁起来了。

en: Forgetting his key, he was able to open the door by inserting a wire in the key hole.
zh: 他没带钥匙，结果用根铁丝插进锁孔就把门弄开了。

en: Your brother is very angry.
zh: 你哥哥非常生气。

en: It's already dark outside.
zh: 外面已经黑了。

en: Distant water won't quench your immediate thirst.
zh: 远水解不了近渴。

en: Could I have a bus timetable?
zh: 能给我一张公交车时刻表吗？

en: As she couldn't pay for a ticket, the driver asked her to get off the bus.
zh: 因为她没钱买票，司机就让她下车了。

en: Look, a shooting star!
zh: 看，是流星！

en: He is very talented musically, able to play at least 5 instruments.
zh: 他很有音乐天赋，至少会弹五种乐器。

en: His openness is a very positive quality, although not without its drawbacks.
zh: 他的坦诚是一个优点，虽然也有其不足之处。

en: Disregarding the "No Entry" sign, she pushed open the door and walked inside.
zh: 她没理会“禁止入内”的牌子，推开门就进去了。

en: The lake was ringed by a fence, apparently for health and safety reasons.
zh: 湖边围了一圈栅栏，显然是为了安全和卫生。

en: I'm skeptical when I hear someone claim to speak more than five languages fluently.
zh: 听到有人宣称能流利地说五种以上的语言，我是持怀疑态度的。

en: I don't quite believe it when I hear someone claim they can speak more than five languages fluently.
zh: 听到有人吹嘘自己能流利地说五种以上的语言，我不怎么相信。

en: You may be able to pass unnoticed in a city, but in a village that's not possible.
zh: 在城市里你可能不会引起注意，但在村子里那是不可能的。

en: I really can't remember people's names, but I don't forget faces.
zh: 我真记不住别人的名字，但我对人脸过目不忘。

en: What examples of behaviour would you consider typically masculine?
zh: 你觉得哪些行为是典型的男性化表现？

en: You’d better start considering doing your project work by yourself!
zh: 你最好还是开始考虑自己动手做项目吧！

en: You can take single words or expressions from the text, but not complete sentences.
zh: 你可以引用文中的词语或短语，但不能照抄完整的句子。

en: How many women do you know that are managers with high levels of responsibility in Italian companies, public or private?
zh: 在意大利的公司里，不管是公营还是私营，你认识多少担任高级管理职务的女性？

en: My son is ten years old.
zh: 我儿子十岁了。

en: It's easier to teach children than to teach adults.
zh: 教小孩比教大人容易。

en: It's easier to teach children than adults.
zh: 小孩比大人好教。

en: That airplane is huge!
zh: 那架飞机真大啊！

en: I wish I could become a bird.
zh: 我真希望自己能变成一只鸟。

en: On what business did you come here?
zh: 你来这儿是有什么事吗？

en: Someone is waiting for you downstairs.
zh: 楼下有人在等你。

en: Since we aren't vegetables, we should live our lives to the fullest.
zh: 既然我们不是植物，就应该活得精彩一点。

en: Tell me what you did to Shounan.
zh: 快跟我说说你对胜男做了什么。

en: If it snows on the mountain, it is cold in the valley.
zh: 要是山上下雪了，山谷里就会很冷。

en: This fold-up umbrella is really small and light, so it's easy to carry around. It's a little pricey, but I think I'll get it.
zh: 这把折叠伞又轻又小，带着很方便。虽然有点贵，但我还是打算买了。

en: I have no idea what that guy is thinking.
zh: 我完全不知道那家伙在想什么。

en: When really lively music starts playing, I start dancing unconsciously.
zh: 只要欢快的音乐一响，我就忍不住跟着跳起舞来。

en: When upbeat music starts playing, I just start dancing.
zh: 音乐一响，我就想跟着跳舞。

en: You should ignore what he says.
zh: 别理他说了什么。

en: My whole body is sticky with sweat. I want to take a bath as quickly as possible in order to feel refreshed.
zh: 我浑身都是汗，粘糊糊的。想赶紧洗个澡清爽一下。

en: For some reason, I'm wide awake and can't fall asleep.
zh: 不知道为什么，我特别清醒，怎么也睡不着。

en: Tomorrow morning, wake me up at 6:00, please.
zh: 明天早上六点记得叫我。

en: My phone was broken.
zh: 我的手机坏了。

en: Tomorrow morning, I'll wake up at 6.
zh: 明天早上我六点起。

en: The category of a hurricane depends on its wind speed.
zh: 飓风的等级取决于它的风速。

en: I got to know her through one of my friends.
zh: 我是通过一个朋友认识她的。

en: Try and do your homework by yourself.
zh: 试着自己写作业。

en: I trust what Matthew, Mark, Luke and John said, and if I were ever the victim in a car accident I'd be very happy if they were my witnesses.
zh: 我相信马太、马可、路加和约翰说的话，如果我出了车祸，有他们当证人我会很高兴。

en: He is completely besotted with her.
zh: 他被她迷得神魂颠倒。

en: I was somehow so awake that I couldn't sleep.
zh: 我也不知道怎么那么精神，一点也睡不着。

en: If you behave like a lackey, you're treated like a lackey.
zh: 你表现得像个跟班，别人就会把你当跟班看。

en: You must certainly be very hungry now.
zh: 你现在一定很饿吧。

en: The knife was so blunt that I could not cut the meat with it and I resorted to my pocket knife.
zh: 这刀太钝了，肉都切不动，我只好用我的折叠小刀。

en: Every even number is the sum of two primes.
zh: 每一个偶数都是两个素数之和。

en: Oh, thanks! How thoughtful.
zh: 噢，谢谢！你真有心。

en: Cutting a cake into equal pieces is rather difficult.
zh: 把蛋糕切成同样大小的几块还挺难的。

en: My canker hurts, so I can't really eat.
zh: 我口腔溃疡疼得厉害，没法吃东西。

en: You do things too sloppily. Please do things more carefully.
zh: 你做事太马虎了。能不能认真一点？

en: Er? What did I come to this room for?
zh: 诶？我进这屋是要干嘛来着？

en: I just cleaned my room today. Why is it so messy?
zh: 我今天刚打扫完房间，怎么又这么乱了？

en: If you understand, then do it properly.
zh: 既然明白了，就把它做好。

en: No matter what I tell him, it's useless, so I don't interfere anymore.
zh: 我跟他怎么说都没用，所以我也懒得管了。

en: When can we see each other again?
zh: 我们什么时候能再见面？

en: Killing your spouse is one way to end a marriage. However, it's frowned upon.
zh: 杀掉配偶也是结束婚姻的一种办法，不过，这事儿可干不得。

en: Would I only work on weekends if I could? Of course, I would.
zh: 要是可以的话，我愿不愿意只在周末工作？那当然了。

en: If you want to go, then go. If you don't want to, then that's fine as well.
zh: 你想去就去，不想去也行。

en: This is our friend Tom.
zh: 这是我们的朋友汤姆。

en: An accident took place at the intersection.
zh: 十字路口出车祸了。

en: Turns out that the house is infested with Garter snakes. They're everywhere!
zh: 结果发现这房子里到处都是束带蛇，哪儿哪儿都是！

en: England is synonymous with football, fish & chips, and the Queen.
zh: 提到英格兰，人们就会想到足球、炸鱼薯条和女王。

en: You absolutely must not tell my girlfriend about this!
zh: 这事儿你千万不能告诉我女朋友！

en: Noted. Thank you.
zh: 知道了，谢谢。

en: So, I didn't call for any particular reason; I just wanted to hear your voice. If you're busy, I'll let you go.
zh: 我打电话没什么特别的事，就是想听听你的声音。你要是忙的话，我就先不打扰了。

en: Do you want to eat prawns?
zh: 你想吃大虾吗？

en: After pay withholding tax, please send the tax paid receipt in PDF format.
zh: 交完预扣税后，请把缴税凭证的PDF文件发过来。

en: The witch hunt has begun.
zh: 猎巫行动开始了。

en: Her picture is really beautiful.
zh: 她的照片真好看。

en: The tea is boiling hot.
zh: 这茶滚烫滚烫的。

en: I would really like to know why he did such a thing.
zh: 我真想知道他为什么要做出那种事。

en: If one can say that a tiger is a big cat, one can also say that a cat is a small tiger.
zh: 要是能说老虎是大猫，那也能说猫是小老虎。

en: Even though I know a little Japanese, I think we'd better speak in English.
zh: 虽然我会一点日语，但我觉得咱们还是说英语吧。

en: He's an Englishman, but lives in India.
zh: 他是英国人，但住在印度。

en: Could I have a piece of cheesecake?
zh: 能给我来块芝士蛋糕吗？

en: If it's okay for her to buy a knife, then why on earth can't I?
zh: 既然她能买刀，凭什么我就不能买？

en: I want another beer.
zh: 我想再来瓶啤酒。

en: African elephants have less hair than Asian elephants.
zh: 非洲象的毛比亚洲象少。

en: I really want to know why he did that kind of thing.
zh: 我真想知道他为什么要做那种事。

en: I'd really like to know why he did that sort of thing.
zh: 我很想知道他为什么要干那种事。

en: We found out that the house is infested with garter snakes. They're everywhere.
zh: 我们发现那房子里到处都是束带蛇，哪儿都是。

en: It turns out that that house is infested with garter snakes. They're everywhere.
zh: 原来那房子里爬满了束带蛇，到处都是。

en: We discovered that that house is infested with garter snakes. They're all over the place!
zh: 我们发现那座房子里全是束带蛇，到处都是！

en: There was an accident at the intersection.
zh: 路口出车祸了。

en: If you want to go, go. If you don't want to, that's OK, too.
zh: 你想去就去，不想去也行。

en: If it were OK for me to only work on weekends, would I do it? Of course, I would.
zh: 要是能只在周末工作，我会干吗？当然会啦。

en: If we'd been on that plane, we'd be dead now.
zh: 要是我们当时在那架飞机上，现在早就没命了。

en: If we'd taken that plane, we'd be dead now.
zh: 要是我们当时坐了那班飞机，现在肯定没命了。

en: That knife was so blunt I couldn't use it to cut the meat so I had to rely on my pocket knife.
zh: 那把刀太钝了，肉都切不动，我只好用我的折叠刀了。

en: That knife wasn't sharp and I couldn't cut the meat with it, so I resorted to using my pocket knife.
zh: 那把刀一点都不快，根本切不动肉，我最后只好用了随身带的小刀。

en: If you behave like a servant, you'll be treated like a servant.
zh: 你把自己当仆人，别人就会把你当仆人对待。

en: If you behave like a flunky, you'll be treated like a flunky.
zh: 如果你表现得像个狗腿子，别人也会把你当狗腿子看。

en: If you behave like a lackey, you'll be treated like a lackey.
zh: 如果你表现得像个奴才，别人也会把你当奴才使唤。

en: I have to go home a little early today.
zh: 我今天得早点回家。

en: I was looking at a dog. However, when I looked again, it had turned into a cat.
zh: 我正看着一只狗呢，结果再一看，它居然变成了一只猫。

en: English is always considered an international language.
zh: 英语一直被公认为是国际通用语言。

en: Hooray!
zh: 太棒了！

en: Cats are like girls. If they talk to you it's great, but if you try to talk to them, it doesn't go so well.
zh: 猫就像女孩子，它们想理你的时候挺好，但你要是想理它们，就不怎么顺利了。

en: The square of any prime number is a semiprime.
zh: 任何质数的平方都是半质数。

en: Usual folks like when other people are similar to themselves, and hate when they are different.
zh: 普通人喜欢跟自己差不多的人，讨厌跟自己不一样的人。

en: My dad likes Lego Technic.
zh: 我爸喜欢乐高机械组。

en: White to play and win.
zh: 白先胜。

en: From time to time, I think about my mother who is no longer living.
zh: 我时不时会想起我过世的母亲。

en: I frequently think about my mother who passed away.
zh: 我经常想起我去世的母亲。

en: It is cold.
zh: 天真冷。

en: It arrived.
zh: 到了。

en: Two times seven is fourteen.
zh: 二七十四。

en: Marie is a naive student.
zh: 玛丽是个很天真的学生。

en: Italy is in Europe.
zh: 意大利在欧洲。

en: It's stopped snowing.
zh: 雪停了。

en: She likes dogs so much that even in the desert she feeds dirty dogs.
zh: 她太喜欢狗了，就算是在沙漠里，她也会去喂那些脏兮兮的流浪狗。

en: As for dogs, I like them.
zh: 至于狗嘛，我还挺喜欢的。

en: I am an English teacher.
zh: 我是英语老师。

en: I am not gay, but my boyfriend is.
zh: 我不是同性恋，但我男朋友是。

en: I'm not gay, but my boyfriend is.
zh: 我不是同性恋，但我男朋友是。

en: My house is situated on the other side of that bridge.
zh: 我家就在那座桥的另一头。

en: From now on, I will not use that word.
zh: 从今往后，我再也不用那个词了。

en: I went to Paris.
zh: 我去了巴黎。

en: I found my shoes.
zh: 我找到我的鞋了。

en: He's at the office.
zh: 他在办公室。

en: The gardener had tulips of various kinds.
zh: 那个园丁种了各种各样的郁金香。

en: I discovered a very nice place today.
zh: 我今天发现了一个特别棒的地方。

en: You speak tremendously fast.
zh: 你说话也太快了。

en: Where did you learn French?
zh: 你在哪儿学的法语？

en: Why don't we go and see a movie?
zh: 咱们去看场电影怎么样？

en: Tom pleaded no contest to a charge of drunken driving.
zh: 汤姆对酒驾的指控选择了不予抗辩。

en: Tom was arrested for drunken driving.
zh: 汤姆因为酒驾被抓了。

en: I paid her five dollars.
zh: 我给了她五块钱。

en: A bunch of people died in the explosion.
zh: 爆炸中死了一大帮人。

en: A bunch of people told me not to eat there.
zh: 好多人都跟我说别在那儿吃。

en: A bunch of people were standing outside waiting.
zh: 外面站着一大群人在等。

en: A child who is a native speaker usually knows many things about his or her language that a non-native speaker who has been studying for years still does not know and perhaps will never know.
zh: 母语是这种语言的小孩通常懂很多关于这门语言的东西，而那些学了很多年的非母语者可能还是不懂，甚至永远都不会懂。

en: A doctor told me that eating eggs was bad for me.
zh: 医生跟我说吃鸡蛋对我身体不好。

en: A gun might come in handy.
zh: 枪可能会派上用场。

en: A lot of people are dealing with allergies now.
zh: 现在好多人都在过敏。

en: A lot of people are dealing with hay fever now.
zh: 现在好多人都有花粉热。

en: A lot of people are going to tell you that you shouldn't have done that.
zh: 很多人都会告诉你，你不该那样做的。

en: A lot of people are interested in camping.
zh: 很多人对露营感兴趣。

en: A lot of people are now trying to sell their houses.
zh: 现在好多人都想把房子卖了。

en: A lot of people are waiting to see what is going to happen.
zh: 很多人都在观望会发生什么。

en: A lot of people who have up until now been spending money having a good time now need to be more careful with their money.
zh: 很多到现在为止一直在花钱买乐子的人，现在花钱得省着点儿了。

en: According to the news, he was eaten by sharks.
zh: 新闻上说他被鲨鱼给吃了。

en: According to the old man I met yesterday, cockroaches can be eaten and don't taste all that bad.
zh: 听我昨天遇到的那个老头儿说，蟑螂是可以吃的，而且味道还不算太糟。

en: After I graduated from college, I got a job with my father's company.
zh: 大学毕业后，我去了我爸的公司上班。

en: After I graduated from college, I moved back home and lived with my parents for three years.
zh: 大学毕业后，我搬回家跟父母住了三年。

en: After I graduated from college, I spent two years traveling around the world.
zh: 大学毕业后，我花了两年时间环游世界。

en: All five rabbits were eaten by the hungry wolves.
zh: 五只兔子全都被饿狼吃了。

en: All four of the boys didn't have alibis.
zh: 那四个男孩都没有不在场证明。

en: All my friends like the same kind of music that I do.
zh: 我所有的朋友喜欢的音乐都跟我一样。

en: All the English teachers at my son's school are native speakers.
zh: 我儿子学校的所有英语老师都是母语人士。

en: All we can do is wait for the police to arrive.
zh: 我们唯一能做的就是等警察来。

en: Am I boring you?
zh: 我是不是让你觉得无聊了？

en: Am I under arrest?
zh: 我被逮捕了吗？

en: Any time you want to borrow my car, all you have to do is ask.
zh: 你什么时候想借我的车，跟我说一声就行。

en: Apparently, the murder happened in a locked room.
zh: 看来谋杀是在密室里发生的。

en: Apparently, we'll be getting a raise within two months.
zh: 看来咱们两个月内就要涨工资了。

en: Are there any bears around here?
zh: 这附近有熊吗？

en: Are you a creature of habit?
zh: 你是个生活习惯很固定的人吗？

en: Are you afraid of the dark?
zh: 你怕黑吗？

en: Are you an only child?
zh: 你是独生子女吗？

en: Are you close to your family?
zh: 你和家里人关系亲近吗？

en: Are you closer to your mother or to your father?
zh: 你跟你妈更亲，还是跟你爸更亲？

en: Are you excited?
zh: 你兴奋吗？

en: Are you going to be OK?
zh: 你没事吧？

en: Are you gonna help me or what?
zh: 你到底帮不帮我？

en: Are you happy with how you look?
zh: 你对自己的长相满意吗？

en: Are you happy with your weight?
zh: 你对自己的体重满意吗？

en: Are you on Facebook?
zh: 你玩脸书吗？

en: Are you responsible for this mess?
zh: 这烂摊子是你搞的吗？

en: Are you seriously thinking about becoming involved?
zh: 你真的打算掺和进来吗？

en: Are you seriously thinking about buying a computer from that store?
zh: 你真的打算在那家店买电脑吗？

en: Are you seriously thinking about buying that old car?
zh: 你真的打算买那辆旧车吗？

en: Are you seriously thinking about divorce?
zh: 你真的在考虑离婚吗？

en: Are you seriously thinking about driving all night?
zh: 你真的打算开一整晚的车吗？

en: Are you seriously thinking about eating all that?
zh: 你真的打算把那些全都吃了吗？

en: Are you seriously thinking about getting a divorce?
zh: 你真的打算离婚吗？

en: Are you seriously thinking about getting involved?
zh: 你真的打算掺和吗？

en: Are you seriously thinking about getting married again at your age?
zh: 你都这把年纪了，还真打算再婚吗？

en: Are you seriously thinking about quitting your job?
zh: 你真的打算辞职吗？

en: Are you still in love with your wife?
zh: 你还爱着你老婆吗？

en: Before you can love others, you need to be able to love yourself.
zh: 爱别人之前，你得先学会爱自己。

en: Can you help look after the kids?
zh: 能帮我照看下孩子吗？

en: Can you remember the first time you heard the Beatles?
zh: 你还记得第一次听披头士是什么时候吗？

en: Could you please clear the table?
zh: 能麻烦你收拾一下桌子吗？

en: Could you please tell me again who your father is?
zh: 能麻烦你再说一遍，你父亲是谁吗？

en: Did you say something?
zh: 你刚才说什么了吗？

en: Didn't you tell me yesterday that you and your boyfriend had broken up?
zh: 你昨天不是跟我说你和你男朋友分手了吗？

en: Do you believe in love at first sight?
zh: 你相信一见钟情吗？

en: Do you feel birthdays are important?
zh: 你觉得过生日重要吗？

en: Do you feel like eating?
zh: 你想吃点东西吗？

en: Do you give to charity?
zh: 你会做慈善吗？

en: Do you have a pet?
zh: 你养宠物吗？

en: Do you have a tattoo?
zh: 你有纹身吗？

en: Do you have a Twitter account?
zh: 你有推特账号吗？

en: Do you have any brothers or sisters?
zh: 你有亲兄弟姐妹吗？

en: Do you have any gum?
zh: 你有口香糖吗？

en: Do you have any tattoos?
zh: 你有纹身吗？

en: Do you know anyone who hums while they work?
zh: 你认识工作时爱哼曲子的人吗？

en: Do you like bowling?
zh: 你喜欢打保龄球吗？

en: Do you like cooking?
zh: 你喜欢做饭吗？

en: Do you like surfing?
zh: 你喜欢冲浪吗？

en: Do you need a lift?
zh: 要搭便车吗？

en: Do you recycle?
zh: 你会做垃圾回收吗？

en: Do you talk to your plants?
zh: 你会跟你的植物说话吗？

en: Do you think I'm crazy?
zh: 你觉得我疯了吗？

en: Do you think I'm fat?
zh: 你觉得我胖吗？

en: Do you think I'm handsome?
zh: 你觉得我帅吗？

en: Do you think I'm pretty?
zh: 你觉得我漂亮吗？

en: Do you think I'm to blame?
zh: 你觉得该怪我吗？

en: Do you think I'm too tall?
zh: 你觉得我太高了吗？

en: Do you think I'm ugly?
zh: 你觉得我丑吗？

en: Do you think I'm wasting my time?
zh: 你觉得我在浪费时间吗？

en: Do you think it's dangerous to eat genetically modified food?
zh: 你觉得吃转基因食品危险吗？

en: Do you think it's my fault?
zh: 你觉得是我的错吗？

en: Do you think that eating with your family is important?
zh: 你觉得和家人一起吃饭重要吗？

en: Doing that sort of thing makes you look stupid.
zh: 那样做会让你显得很蠢。

en: Don't cry.
zh: 别哭了。

en: Don't worry. I told you everything would be OK.
zh: 别担心，我说了会没事的。

en: Don't you have an air conditioner?
zh: 你家没空调吗？

en: Every student who has graduated from our university has studied English with a native speaker for at least two years.
zh: 我们学校毕业的每个学生都跟外教老师学了至少两年的英语。

en: Everybody in the building felt the earthquake.
zh: 这栋楼里的所有人都感觉到地震了。

en: Everybody in the room let out a sigh of relief.
zh: 屋子里的所有人都松了一口气。

en: Everything's going to be OK.
zh: 没事的，一切都会好起来的。

en: Everywhere you look you can see damage caused by the earthquake.
zh: 随处可见地震造成的破坏。

en: For some reason, people have been avoiding me like the plague ever since I got back from India.
zh: 不知道为什么，自从我从印度回来，大家就一直躲着我，像躲瘟神一样。

en: Have both of you already eaten?
zh: 你们两个都吃了吗？

en: Have you been told where the meeting will be?
zh: 有人告诉你开会的地点在哪儿了吗？

en: Have you eaten dinner?
zh: 你吃晚饭了吗？

en: Have you eaten?
zh: 你吃了吗？

en: Have you ever been mugged?
zh: 你被抢劫过吗？

en: Have you ever been on TV?
zh: 你上过电视吗？

en: Have you ever been stuck in an elevator?
zh: 你有没有被困在电梯里过？

en: Have you ever broken a bone?
zh: 你骨折过吗？

en: Have you ever cheated on an exam?
zh: 你考试作弊过吗？

en: Have you ever donated blood?
zh: 你献过血吗？

en: Have you ever done any volunteer work?
zh: 你做过志愿者吗？

en: Have you ever driven a sports car?
zh: 你开过跑车吗？

en: Have you ever dyed your hair?
zh: 你染过头发吗？

en: Have you ever sung in public?
zh: 你在公开场合唱过歌吗？

en: He is lying through his teeth.
zh: 他在睁着眼说瞎话。

en: He lied to my face.
zh: 他当面跟我撒谎。

en: Her husband eats everything she puts in front of him.
zh: 她老公不管她端上来什么都吃。

en: Hey, wait up!
zh: 哎，等等我！

en: How can I get my toddler to eat vegetables?
zh: 怎么才能让小孩儿吃蔬菜呢？

en: How do you remove red wine stains from your carpet?
zh: 地毯上的红酒渍怎么去掉？

en: How is your dad?
zh: 你爸身体怎么样？

en: How many different schools have you attended?
zh: 你以前在几所学校读过书？

en: How many kinds of vegetables do you grow in your garden?
zh: 你家菜园里种了几种蔬菜？

en: How much TV do you watch?
zh: 你平时看多长时间电视？

en: How was your afternoon?
zh: 你下午过得怎么样？

en: How was your day?
zh: 你今天过得怎么样？

en: How was your night?
zh: 你晚上过得怎么样？

en: How was your summer?
zh: 你这个暑假过得怎么样？

en: I am not getting involved.
zh: 我才不掺和呢。

en: I asked them to fix my car.
zh: 我让他们帮我修了车。

en: I ate a burger, then went to bed.
zh: 我吃了个汉堡就去睡了。

en: I ate a large pizza with a friend an hour ago.
zh: 一小时前我和朋友吃了一个大号披萨。

en: I ate too much.
zh: 我吃撑了。

en: I can still remember the time when we went on a picnic together.
zh: 我还记得我们以前一起去野餐的时候。

en: I can't believe that you actually got into Harvard.
zh: 真不敢相信你居然考上哈佛了。

en: I can't figure out how to open this suitcase.
zh: 我搞不清楚这箱子怎么打开。

en: I can't figure out how to upload an image.
zh: 我搞不懂怎么上传图片。

en: I can't tell you everything.
zh: 我不能全都告诉你。

en: I can't tell you exactly how long it will take.
zh: 我没法确切地告诉你需要多长时间。

en: I can't tell you what we did last night.
zh: 我不能告诉你我们昨晚干什么了。

en: I didn't eat dinner last night.
zh: 我昨晚没吃晚饭。

en: I didn't hear you come in.
zh: 我没听到你进来。

en: I don't care about your past.
zh: 我不在乎你的过去。

en: I don't eat chicken skin.
zh: 我不吃鸡皮。

en: I don't enjoy traveling in large groups.
zh: 我不喜欢跟大团旅游。

en: I don't know what you're talking about.
zh: 我不知道你在说什么。

en: I don't need an explanation.
zh: 我不需要解释。

en: I don't think many people can say they are satisfied with their salary.
zh: 我觉得没多少人会对自己的工资感到满意。

en: I don't want to eat here.
zh: 我不想在这儿吃。

en: I don't want to talk to you.
zh: 我不想跟你说话。

en: I doubt that our new boss will be any worse than the old one.
zh: 我不觉得新老板会比旧老板更差。

en: I eat lunch every day at noon.
zh: 我每天中午十二点吃午饭。

en: I found it necessary to get assistance.
zh: 我觉得有必要找人帮帮忙。

en: I grew up eating Japanese food.
zh: 我是吃着日料长大的。

en: I had never eaten any kind of Thai food, so I was pretty excited about going to a Thai restaurant with my grandmother.
zh: 我以前从来没吃过泰国菜，所以跟我奶奶去泰国餐厅时特别兴奋。

en: I hate jealous women.
zh: 我讨厌爱吃醋的女人。

en: I haven't eaten French food since I left France.
zh: 离开法国后我就没吃过法餐了。

en: I hear that he eats frogs.
zh: 我听说他吃田鸡。

en: I heard that one way to stay healthy is to avoid eating any food with unpronounceable ingredients.
zh: 我听说保持健康的一个方法就是别吃那些成分名字长到念不出来的东西。

en: I just got up. Give me a few minutes to get ready.
zh: 我刚起。等我几分钟收拾一下。

en: I know that I don't deserve you.
zh: 我知道我配不上你。

en: I know the reason, but I can't tell you.
zh: 我知道原因，但我不能告诉你。

en: I know you've been avoiding me.
zh: 我知道你一直在躲着我。

en: I know you've been waiting a long time, but could you wait just a little bit longer?
zh: 我知道你等很久了，但能不能再稍微等一下？

en: I like the way you talk.
zh: 我喜欢你说话的样子。

en: I like you a whole lot.
zh: 我特别喜欢你。

en: I love Italian food.
zh: 我超爱意大利菜。

en: I love roller skating.
zh: 我喜欢滑旱冰。

en: I met an old man who says that he's never eaten at a restaurant in his whole life.
zh: 我遇到个老头，他说他这辈子从来没在餐厅里吃过饭。

en: I need your answer by the end of the day.
zh: 今天下班前我需要你的答复。

en: I never felt this way before I met you.
zh: 在遇到你之前，我从来没有过这种感觉。

en: I never imagined anything like this.
zh: 我从没想过会发生这种事。

en: I never imagined we'd be talking about this topic today.
zh: 我从没想过咱们今天会聊到这个话题。

en: I never thought it'd be this hard to build a picnic table.
zh: 我没想过做一个野餐桌会这么难。

en: I never thought it'd be this hard to create an iPad app.
zh: 我没想过做一个iPad应用会这么难。

en: I never thought this rubber band would come in handy when I put it in my pocket this morning.
zh: 早上我把这根皮筋塞进口袋的时候，真没想到它还能派上用场。

en: I never thought we'd end up like this.
zh: 我没想过我们会变成这样。

en: I now view life differently than I used to.
zh: 我现在看生活的眼光跟以前不一样了。

en: I plan to buy a new car as soon as I can afford one.
zh: 我打算一买得起就换辆新车。

en: I plan to leave Boston as soon as I can.
zh: 我打算一有机会就离开波士顿。

en: I promise you I'll come early.
zh: 我保证我会早点来的。

en: I promise you I'll help you.
zh: 我保证会帮你的。

en: I put some cookies on the table and the kids ate them right up.
zh: 我把饼干放在桌上，孩子们一下就给吃光了。

en: I really like you.
zh: 我真的很喜欢你。

en: I seldom eat dairy products.
zh: 我很少吃乳制品。

en: I should go home and get some sleep.
zh: 我该回家睡一觉了。

en: I should have listened more carefully.
zh: 我当时应该再听仔细点的。

en: I should head out.
zh: 我该走了。

en: I should've listened to what my mother said.
zh: 我真该听我妈的话。

en: I shouldn't have eaten the whole bag of potato chips.
zh: 我真不该吃掉那一整袋薯片。

en: I shouldn't have gotten up so early.
zh: 我真不该起这么早。

en: I shouldn't have sent that email.
zh: 我真不该发那封邮件。

en: I shouldn't have stayed up all night.
zh: 我真不该熬通宵。

en: I shouldn't have used the word "password" as my password.
zh: 我不该用“password”当我的密码的。

en: I shouldn't have walked home late at night by myself.
zh: 我不该大半夜一个人走路回家的。

en: I shouldn't have wasted my time reading that.
zh: 我真不该浪费时间看那个。

en: I sometimes feel drowsy in the early afternoon.
zh: 下午刚开始那会儿，我偶尔会犯困。

en: I studied English for four years with a native speaker.
zh: 我跟外教学了四年英语。

en: I suggest that you go and see a doctor about this as soon as you can.
zh: 我建议你还是尽早去医院看看。

en: I think I'm going crazy.
zh: 我觉得我要疯了。

en: I think I'm losing my mind.
zh: 我觉得我快崩溃了。

en: I think I'm really in love for the first time.
zh: 我觉得这可能是我第一次真的恋爱了。

en: I think if I talked more often with a native speaker, my English skills would improve quickly.
zh: 我觉得要是能多跟老外聊天，我英语肯定进步得很快。

en: I think it's a shame that some foreign language teachers were able to graduate from college without ever having studied with a native speaker.
zh: 我觉得挺可惜的，有些外语老师大学毕业前竟然都没跟外教学习过。

en: I think it's highly unlikely that you'll be able to do that by yourself.
zh: 我觉得你一个人肯定搞不定。

en: I think it's unhealthy to eat more than 20 oranges a day.
zh: 我觉得一天吃20多个橙子太不健康了。

en: I think it's unlikely that a situation like this one would ever occur again.
zh: 我觉得这种情况不太可能再发生了。

en: I think it's unlikely that aliens similar to what we see in the movies have ever visited our planet.
zh: 我觉得像电影里那种外星人应该没来过地球。

en: I think it's unlikely that any store would sell this model for that price.
zh: 我觉得没哪家店会按这个价卖这款。

en: I think it's unlikely that I'll be able to pass my driving test.
zh: 我觉得我驾照考试够呛能过。

en: I think it's unlikely that plants feel pain.
zh: 我觉得植物应该感觉不到疼。

en: I think it's unlikely that the next model will be any better than this one.
zh: 我觉得下一代产品未必比这个好。

en: I think it's unlikely that the next version of Windows will come out before the end of this month.
zh: 我觉得月底前不太可能出新版Windows。

en: I think skateboards are usually cheaper than rollerblades.
zh: 我觉得滑板通常比轮滑鞋便宜。

en: I think that we should try again.
zh: 我觉得咱们应该再试一次。

en: I think the time is right to introduce this product.
zh: 我觉得现在是推这款产品的好时机。

en: I think there's something wrong with you.
zh: 我觉得你是不是哪儿有点儿问题。

en: I think this tie will go great with that shirt.
zh: 我觉得这条领带跟那件衬衫挺搭的。

en: I think we should use our time a bit more constructively.
zh: 我觉得咱们的时间应该花在更有意义的事儿上。

en: I think you're the woman I've been waiting for all my life.
zh: 我觉得你就是我这辈子一直等的那个人。

en: I think you should change your eating habits.
zh: 我觉得你该改改饮食习惯了。

en: I think you've got what I need.
zh: 我觉得你手里有我需要的东西。

en: I thought a bunch of people would go water skiing with us, but absolutely no one else showed up.
zh: 我还以为会有一帮人跟咱们去滑水呢，结果一个都没来。

en: I thought doing this would be easy, but we've been working all day and we're still not finished.
zh: 我本以为这事儿挺简单的，结果干了一整天还没干完。

en: I thought doing this would be easy.
zh: 我本以为这事儿会挺简单的。

en: I thought I'd try eating Mexican food today.
zh: 我今天想试试吃墨西哥菜。

en: I thought we had eaten everything in the house, but I found another box of crackers.
zh: 我以为家里的东西都吃光了，结果又翻出来一盒饼干。

en: I thought we were going to go somewhere.
zh: 我还以为咱们要去哪儿呢。

en: I told the children to be quiet, but they just kept on being noisy.
zh: 我让孩子们安静点，但他们还是吵个不停。

en: I told you guys to go home. Why are you still here?
zh: 我都让你们回家了，怎么还在呢？

en: I was just wondering if maybe there was some more milk in the refrigerator.
zh: 我就在想冰箱里是不是还有点牛奶。

en: I will send you a copy of this picture as soon as I can.
zh: 我会尽快把这张照片发给你的。

en: I wish I could figure out how to control my appetite.
zh: 要是我能知道怎么管住嘴就好了。

en: I wish my back didn't always hurt so much.
zh: 要是我这腰不总这么疼就好了。

en: I wish my leg didn't hurt so much.
zh: 要是我腿没这么疼就好了。

en: I wish she would eat what I give her without complaining.
zh: 我真希望我给她什么她就吃什么，别老抱怨。

en: I wonder what we'll be doing this time next year.
zh: 也不知道明年这时候咱们在干吗。

en: I'd like to get to know you better.
zh: 我想多了解了解你。

en: I'd love to hang out with you this weekend.
zh: 这个周末我挺想跟你出去玩的。

en: I'll see you next Wednesday.
zh: 下周三见。

en: I'm faithful to my wife.
zh: 我对老婆很忠诚。

en: I'm falling in love with you.
zh: 我好像爱上你了。

en: I'm in no hurry.
zh: 我不急。

en: I'm not going to see you again.
zh: 我以后不会再见你了。

en: I'm so sorry.
zh: 真的很对不起。

en: I'm sure it wouldn't be too hard to find out who hacked into our system.
zh: 我敢肯定，想查出谁黑了咱们的系统并不难。

en: I've always wanted to climb Mt. Fuji.
zh: 我一直都想去爬富士山。

en: I've been thinking about the meaning of life.
zh: 我一直在思考人生的意义。

en: I've made up my mind to go.
zh: 我已经下定决心要去了。

en: In the end, we ended up eating at that shabby restaurant.
zh: 结果，我们最后还是在那家破旧的餐馆吃了。

en: Instead of eating vegetables, he puts them in a blender and drinks them.
zh: 他不吃蔬菜，而是把它们放进搅拌机打碎了喝。

en: Is eating a clove of garlic every day beneficial to your health?
zh: 每天吃一瓣大蒜对健康有好处吗？

en: Is it OK for some kid to show you up?
zh: 让个小屁孩抢了你的风头，你也觉得无所谓吗？

en: Is it safe for children to eat in smoky restaurants?
zh: 孩子在烟味很重的餐厅里吃饭安全吗？

en: Is it safe to eat food that has dropped on the floor?
zh: 掉在地上的东西还能吃吗？

en: It looks like the thief came in through the window.
zh: 看起来小偷是从窗户进来的。

en: It seems like summer is finally here.
zh: 看来夏天终于到了。

en: It seems like you got up on the wrong side of the bed this morning.
zh: 你今天早上起来是不是心情不好？

en: It's dangerous to play with fire.
zh: 玩火很危险。

en: It's likely to get cold tonight, so you may need an extra blanket.
zh: 今晚可能会变冷，你可能需要多盖条毯子。

en: Let me give this to you before I forget.
zh: 趁我还没忘，先把这个给你。

en: Make a wish.
zh: 许个愿吧。

en: Most people say that the best way to learn a foreign language is to learn from a native speaker.
zh: 大多数人都说学习外语最好的方法就是跟母语者学。

en: Most people studying a foreign language will never be able to speak like a native speaker.
zh: 大多数学外语的人都永远没法说得像母语者那样地道。

en: Our favorite place to eat is that small restaurant on the corner.
zh: 我们最喜欢去拐角那家小餐馆吃饭。

en: Please don't walk so fast.
zh: 请别走那么快。

en: Some people eat sushi with their hands.
zh: 有些人会直接用手抓着吃寿司。

en: Some people think eating at home is better for you than eating out.
zh: 有些人觉得在家里吃比在外面吃更好。

en: Some people think that it is difficult for a native speaker of English to learn Chinese, but I disagree.
zh: 有人觉得母语是英语的人学中文很难，但我不这么认为。

en: Thank you for listening.
zh: 谢谢你听我说话。

en: That's amazing!
zh: 太不可思议了！

en: The best cookies I've ever eaten are the ones that your mother baked for me.
zh: 我吃过最好吃的饼干就是你妈妈为我烤的那些。

en: The boy I saw searching through the garbage can said that he had not eaten anything for four days.
zh: 我看到的那个在翻垃圾桶的小男孩说，他已经四天没吃东西了。

en: The police found some blood on the floor.
zh: 警察在地上发现了一些血迹。

en: There have been a lot of complaints about that policy.
zh: 关于那个政策有很多投诉。

en: There's no point going there now. I'm sure they are closed.
zh: 现在去那儿没意义了，我肯定他们已经关门了。

en: They rushed the woman to the hospital after she ate a lightbulb.
zh: 那个女人吞了个灯泡后被紧急送往了医院。

en: They say that in America anyone can become president, but perhaps that's not really true.
zh: 都说在美国谁都能当总统，但也许事实并非如此。

en: This is a pretty amazing place.
zh: 这地方挺不错的。

en: This is the most beautiful beach in the whole world.
zh: 这是全世界最漂亮的海滩。

en: This just might come in handy someday.
zh: 这个说不定哪天就能派上用场。

en: This may just come in handy someday.
zh: 这个没准以后能用得着。

en: This suitcase is too heavy for me to carry.
zh: 这个行李箱太重了，我提不动。

en: Three missionaries were killed and eaten by cannibals.
zh: 三名传教士被食人族杀掉并吃掉了。

en: Today is our last day of school.
zh: 今天是我们最后一天上学。

en: We had a little trouble with the equipment yesterday.
zh: 昨天我们的设备出了点小问题。

en: We have to live with the consequences of our actions.
zh: 我们必须承担自己行为的后果。

en: We have to live with the consequences of our choices.
zh: 我们必须承担自己选择的后果。

en: We shouldn't have to be dealing with this problem now.
zh: 我们现在本不该还在处理这个问题的。

en: We'll eventually find a solution to this problem, I think.
zh: 我觉得我们最终会找到解决这个问题的办法。

en: Were you really playing chess at 11:30 last night?
zh: 昨晚十一点半你真的在下象棋？

en: What can I do to sound more like a native speaker?
zh: 我怎么才能说得更像个地道的母语者？

en: What do you consider your greatest achievement?
zh: 你觉得你最大的成就是什么？
